title: Protein Large Language Models: A Comprehensive Survey
author: Yijia Xiao (UCLA), Wanjia Zhao (Stanford), Junkai Zhang (UCLA), Yiqiao Jin (Georgia Tech), Han Zhang (UCLA), Zhicheng Ren (UCLA), Renliang Sun (UCLA), Haixin Wang (UCLA), ..., Wei Wang (UCLA)
relevance_why: This survey covers diverse methodologies and applications of Protein Large Language Models (Protein LLMs), which are relevant for deepening understanding of sequence-function relationships, crucial in audio analysis tasks involving biological datasets.
background: The paper provides a comprehensive overview of Protein LLMs, focusing on their architectures, training methodologies, and applications in protein science, enabling more efficient protein analysis and design.
contribution: The survey introduces a structured taxonomy of Protein LLMs and analyzes their use of large protein datasets for enhanced accuracy, contributing to advancements in protein engineering and biomedical research.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous surveys addressed only specific aspects or applications of Protein LLMs, often lacking depth in architecture and training data exploration.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work systematically analyzes over 100 articles, providing a structured overview of diverse architectures and evaluation metrics, significantly enhancing the understanding of Protein LLMs' capabilities.

key_innovation: Presents a comprehensive taxonomy and in-depth analysis of the evolution of Protein LLMs and their practical implications across various protein research applications.
real_world_impact: This survey positions Protein LLMs as vital tools for advancing protein science, potentially accelerating discoveries in fields such as drug design and molecular biology.
limitations: The survey focuses mainly on Protein LLMs and does not extensively cover the interactions between proteins and other molecules, which could provide a broader perspective on protein research.

new_terms.Protein Large Language Models (Protein L: **Protein Large Language Models (Protein LLMs)** refer to models designed to understand and predict protein behavior based on large-scale protein sequence data, utilizing techniques from language modeling to analyze biological structures and functions.
